Articles.Content:
So here are my mods: [http://gyazo.com/1193d0b8f87faca323d7a38512ecad11](http://gyazo.com/1193d0b8f87faca323d7a38512ecad11)

Now, when I go to test a plane, whether it be launching from the VAB or the Runway, I'll revert to VAB or SPH, and the game just closes. Just like that. Any idea on what's going on?

No clue. Your not running that many mods. So it couldn't be memory issue. Unless your running the full Kerbin Side package that can get pretty demanding. But still I think there is something else going on. Post your output.log and we can tell you exactly what. 

I'd tell ya where to find it, but I cannot for the life of me remember the folder. KSP\_Data I believe you can find it in. I'm not at my pc to see exactly right now. Just rummage around the ksp directory, you'll find it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-12T18:19:04Z" title="06/12/2015 06:19  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 12, 2015</time> by Motokid600**
No way I can post that entire notepad. XD How can i post it without it being a mile long text?
[**Hastebin**](hastebin.com) is pretty good for posting text ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
I have this but the only mods I have in common are adjustable landing gear and collision fx.
Here ya go. I cut out a lot of it and left what i believe is most important. [http://hastebin.com/edesibeqol.tex](http://hastebin.com/edesibeqol.tex)

> 
> OutOfMemoryException: Out of memory

This line in the part of the log you posted is saying it. Can you post the first 20-30 lines from that log too? Better info there if you are running out of memory.
How much memory does your pc have? I cant imagine how your running out of memory with that little amount of mods, but the proof is in the pudding i suppose.
I have 8 gigs of memory. Here are the first 20-30 lines: [http://hastebin.com/safoluwidi.tex](http://hastebin.com/safoluwidi.tex)

Hmm. That it just crash without any error can be because you have Steam/KSP installed into

> 
> C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Kerbal Space Program

and Windows don't give the rights to write to disk. Try run Steam/KSP as admin \*Right Steam/KSP exe and say "Run like Admin.."\*
